column5: ive decided to just go camping for a few days this year and save money to do a special trip with my best friend next year. looking for trophy and numbers,we would prefer an outpost with housekeeping plan and would like the outpost to be on the nicer side with a shower and even possibly electricity and satellite tv(not a deal breaker,but would be nice)or budget is $3500 cad a piece id love to hear your suggestions\ i have been hearing wonderful things about north caribou lodge,but it says a minimum party of 4 at the outpost
i would suggest a fly-in somewhere. Tons of them available at several different prices
lol,i was literally just searching that site!

Hey, If you really want to fish North Caribou and you only have 2 guys...post the opening and I bet you can find a couple of like-minded guys who also want to fish it, but only have 2. NCL would be an excellent choice. Brett

Check out www.clarksresorts.com They have everything you need 2 drive ins and 22 fly out outposts with showers and electricity and supply free minnows and bottled water.they do have satellite tv and cell and wifi service at there anishinabi lake lodge.All they lakes and the portages are loaded with all species. Diffently need to check them out..

Suggest calling North caribou since there are 3 cabins, maybe he could take a 2 some depending? pm me for suggestions, I have been to ganglers, Tazin, NWT, Dunlops, Bolton, Evans(qb) and many Ontario camps
x2 for clarksresorts.com also checkout www.wilderness-air-escapes.com

Just to let you know that the Clark's Anishinabi Lake Lodge has one cabin (guide shack) meant for 2 people.balcony over looking the water.my wife and I stayed there last July for 4 days.many fishing opportunities main lake has trout,bass and some pretty big northern pike.5-6 walleye portages lakes which are some of the best walleye pike lakes and 2 portages trout lakes also that fish very fast.15 min flight from there base camp on cedar lake.anishinabi lodge is on a small island.cell and WiFi at the lodge.www.clarksresorts.com. Check out there other outposts.
